betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You were expecting something to happen when the dormant power of a Division Sigil was awakened. You were not expecting a fast spawning horde of powered up monsters!

What twisted power does this cursed earth possess!? And what do you need to grab a few samples to-right, Silk Touch. You knew you'd find more uses for that old Amber shovel eventually. Afterwards you think you'd best wait for dawn. If the Sigil needs to be activated at night than surely light is harmful to this stuff.

Studying the blocks you gathered you realize they can be used to make a mob spawner. Or, placed directly underneath a vanilla spawner, let it run even when you're not around.

You're sure that has many applications, but you'll need to consider each and every one of them very carefully. Mob farms, especially poorly designed ones, can easily end up killing performance...

Â§4Case in point, when setting up a mob spawner in the Nether make sure the Cursed Earth is not attached to anything from the Nether. For example, you can place it on top of marble, but the marble cannot touch anything in the nether (netherrack, brick, etc), and must be floating in the air. Also, limit the Cursed Earth to 1 chunk max, with 2 block buffer to the chunk edge, including a wall.
